result.execSummary:
The defendant Michael L Peters was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Contact after Domestic Abuse Arrest [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 968.075(5)(a)1.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Outstanding financial obligations are not a condition of probation & are to be paid directly to the Shawano Co Clerk of Court office within 30 days.  Debts older than 60 days will be processed for tax intercept & civil judgments.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.  Payment plans available for qualifying amounts.
All financials same as noted above.
Huber / work release granted for any purpose the Law allows.

Obtain Domestic Violence assessment through a certified (WBTP) Wisconsin batterer's treatment provider and followthrough with all treatment recommendations.
AODA evaluation and followthrough.
Absolute sobriety.
Submit DNA sample.
No contact with victim only if Agent feels it appropriate, otherwise allowed contact.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Michael L Peters

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: per DE by phone call inquiring on TRIP, he is now know as Michael L Pamanet

Defendant Michael L Peters in court with attorney Ronald Duane Haacke.  Scott E. Niemi appeared for the State of Wisconsin. DA moves to dismiss the DV enhancer which will reduce the charge back to a misdemeanor. Defendant pleads guilty as amended.  Court advises party of their rights, finds factual basis, accepts defendant's waiver of their rights, the plea made, and finds guilty. Arguments as to penalty.  Court imposes and stays 60 days jail, 18 months probation with conditions.  Appeal rights.

records.descr: Answer to demand for discovery and inspection

records.addlTxt: from DA to Atty Haacke re: Discovery pg's 1-13 & driver/criminal record

Defendant Michael L Peters in court with attorney Ronald Duane Haacke.  Catharine Denise White appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Dep. Shane Breitenbach sworn & testifies.  Ex. 1-Conditional Release form marked & id'd.  ADA White moves to admit Ex. 1, no objections, Court admits.  Cross-exam.   ADA White requests continuance as neither of the witnesses can identify DE as Michael Peters. Atty Haacke-DE stipulates  he is Michael Peters.  ADA White - requests Court take Judicial Notice of prior convictions.  Court reviews, no objection, Court accepts.  ADA White requests bind over. Atty Haacke argues.  Court finds probable cause and binds the matter over for trial.  
ARRAINGMENT:  DE enters NG plea.  Court accepts.  PTC to be set with JA.

records.descr: Waiver of time limits for preliminary hearing

records.addlTxt: Defendant Michael L Peters in court with attorney Ronald Duane Haacke.  Scott E. Niemi appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Preliminary hearing requested.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for January 5, 2016 at 08:15 am.

Defendant Michael L Peters in court.  Scott E. Niemi appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attny Zarzynski has advised defendant to hire local counsel for this case.  Court will give defendant additional time to find an attorney.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for September 28, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Michael L Peters in court.  Scott E. Niemi appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court spoke with attorney who indicates he hasn't spoken to the defendant.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for August 31, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Michael L Peters in court.  Scott E. Niemi appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Has spoken with counsel.  Court adfjourns for defendant to appear with attorney.  Attorney can appear by phone.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for August 17, 2015 at 02:30 pm.

Defendant Michael L Peters in court.  Scott E. Niemi appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Has spoken with counsel but not at length and requests more time.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for August 3, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Michael L Peters in court.  Scott E. Niemi appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Right to counsel given - defendant wishes to speak with an attorney.  Court sets bond at $500 signature.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for July 13, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
